oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Angeline Butler on Nashville Sit-Ins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Student organizer Angeline Butler speaks about her experience organizing sit-ins in Nashville.

Angeline Butler is an educator and Civil Rights activist. She was an original organizer of the Nashville Sit-Ins, the Freedom Rides, and the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee (SNCC). She also helped organize the March on Washington. Butler currently teaches at the John Jay College of Criminal Justice.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Fisk University; Tennessee Agricultural and Industrial State College; Civil rights demonstrations; Student movements; College students; Butler, Angeline;
